meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Ah, Die By The Blade, where do I even start? As a seasoned (get it?) reviewer, I've had my fair share of mediocre games, but this one... well, let's just say it's got some... blades to sharpen.

First off, kudos to the developers for trying. Bushido Blade fans will appreciate the homage, and those looking for a quick 1v1 samurai fight fest might find some fun in here. But, oh dear, where do I even start with the rest?

God is a Geek said it's got "a few good ideas" but ultimately fails to generate any excitement. Well, I'm not sure about that, but I do know Die By The Blade has plenty of... "good" moments (read: not-so-good). The Games Machine praised its video game mission, which, honestly, sounds like a snooze-fest for me.

CGMagazine called it a "battle of attrition," which is just as thrilling as it sounds. Wccftech basically trashed the whole thing, saying it's got "horrendously slow progression" and "extreme lack of content." Ouch! Finger Guns liked its addictive swordplay (who doesn't love lightning-fast fights?), but even they said it falls short in terms of a full release title.

GamingBolt just called it a straightforward 1v1 samurai fighting game with... well, not much else to say. And GameMAG? They thought it felt like an early access title (ouch, again!). Yeah, I can see why.

Now, don't get me wrong; Die By The Blade isn't all bad. It's got its moments (read: a few sparks in the darkness). But, honestly? This game is as sharp as a butter knife. Okay, maybe that's unfair – it's more like... well, you'll just have to play it yourself.

So, will I recommend it? Well, if you're looking for some quick fights with friends, sure thing! Just don't expect too much in the way of content or excitement. But hey, that's what early access is all about, right?

In conclusion, Die By The Blade is like a samurai sword – sharp on the edges but lacking in substance. Maybe with some TLC (or a few more blades sharpened), it could become something worth wielding... I mean, playing.

Stay tuned for my next review, and remember: when life gives you lemons, make lemonade. When life gives you Die By The Blade, well... that's up to you!
